The presence of this large vehicle directly ahead of the ego car influences the driving behavior by requiring maintaining a safe following distance due to its size and the potential for sudden stops or debris falling from the vehicle. Be cautious of the adjacent passenger cars, especially those that may be preparing to change lanes or turn. Keep an eye on the cyclist; be prepared to slow down or adjust lane position if they move unpredictably. As the traffic light ahead shows a red signal for turning left and a green light for going straight, prepare to come to a complete stop at the intersection if intending to turn left and wait for the signal to change before proceeding. Stay in the current lane and respect the median barrier's role in traffic management. Continue to observe the road conditions and traffic signals for any changes that may require a reaction from the ego car.
